alert.note: Alert for Southern Columbia; Suwannee; Union (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 04 at 1:43PM EST by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Union, southern Columbia and southeastern Suwannee Counties through 215 PM EST... At 142 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Obrien, or 12 miles east of Mayo, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake City, Ichetucknee Spring, Columbia, Wellborn, Watertown, Obrien, Mcalpin, Five Points, Branford and Hildreth. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
